name: Chocolate Chunk Almond Butter Zucchini Bread with Salted Maple Butter
description: One bowl, pantry staple ingredients, super quick to mix up, kind of healthy, and oh so delicious!

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 medium-size zucchini, grated (about 2 cups grated before squeezing out water)
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 medium-size zucchini, grated (about 2 cups grated before squeezing out water)

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 stick (1/2 cup) melted coconut oil or melted butter
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 stick (1/2 cup) melted coconut oil or melted butter

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 cups whole wheat pastry flour, or all-purpose flour
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 cups whole wheat pastry flour, or all-purpose flour

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chunks
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chunks

recipe_ingredient.note: 4 tablespoons salted butter, at room temperature
recipe_ingredient.display: 4 tablespoons salted butter, at room temperature

recipe_instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch bread pan.
Lay a clean towel on the counter and spread the zucchini out in an even layer, sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt, cover with another towel, and let sit 10 minutes, then squeeze out any excess water.

In a large bowl, stir together the melted coconut oil or melted butter, maple syrup, eggs, and vanilla until combined. Mix in the squeezed out zucchini. Add the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt, mix until just combined. Fold in the chocolate. Dollop the almond butter in teaspoon size amounts directly into the batter. Gently swirl the almond butter in, being careful not to overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared bread pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until center is just set. If the bread is browning before it's done cooking, cover with foil.
Meanwhile, make the maple butter. In a small bowl, combine the butter and maple syrup.
Remove the bread and let cool for at least 30 minutes before cutting...or just eat it warm with a smear of maple butter. Enjoy!
